dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: The U.S. is reopening that fraud investigation into Julian Assange, after his own lawyer requested it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The U.S. is reopening that fraud investigation into Julian Assange, after his own lawyer requested it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Sweden is reopening an investigation into allegations of rape against Wikileaks founder Julian Assange. The announcement landed Monday, after the lawyer for the alleged victim requested in early April the Swedish Prosecution Authority look into the case again.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Wait, his own lawyer asked for it? That's uh, pretty unusual, isn't it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, his own lawyer asked for it? That's uh, pretty unusual, isn't it?

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, apparently back in early June. And he's already admitted to the fraud allegations from 2008.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, apparently back in early June. And he's already admitted to the fraud allegations from two thousand eight.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The announcement landed Monday, after the lawyer for the alleged victim requested in early April the Swedish Prosecution Authority look into the case again. Assange, who denies the rape allegations first made in 2010, has faced numerous legal actions over the last month.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and he spent seven years in that Russian embassy in Washington, didn't he? Avoiding extradition.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and he spent seven years in that Russian embassy in Washington, didn't he? Avoiding extradition.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Having spent seven years in the Ecuadorian embassy in London, where he'd taken asylum to avoid extradition to Sweden, Assange was sentenced to 50 weeks for breaking his bail conditions at the start of May.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. But now he's out, and in a Moscow prison. So extradition's back on the table—either to the U.K. or the U.S.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. But now he's out, and in a Moscow prison. So extradition's back on the table-either to the U.K. or the U.S.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: With Assange now out of the embassy and in a London prison, he could now face extradition to Sweden or the U.S.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And the British issued a global arrest warrant too. It's getting messy.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the British issued a global arrest warrant too. It's getting messy.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Swedish prosecutor will issue a European arrest warrant.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. And then there's this alleged conspiracy with Edward Snowden to hack a military general's emails.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. And then there's this alleged conspiracy with Edward Snowden to hack a military general's emails.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He was also indicted by the U.S. government over an alleged conspiracy with Chelsea Manning to crack the password of a military computer in order to steal sensitive files.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh wow, I hadn't heard that part. So he's got multiple legal fronts now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh wow, I hadn't heard that part. So he's got multiple legal fronts now.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and the U.N. had dropped the case in 2018, but now it's all coming back.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and the U.N. had dropped the case in twenty eighteen, but now it's all coming back.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Swedish prosecutors had initially dropped the case in 2017, after deciding they'd exhausted all possible avenues to properly investigate the allegations.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And Putin even weighed in, saying the Russian case might proceed first if Assange refuses to cooperate.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And Putin even weighed in, saying the Russian case might proceed first if Assange refuses to cooperate.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: However, in my view the Swedish case can proceed concurrently with the proceedings in the U.K. Persson said investigators will ask for an interview with Assange in the U.K., but noted it would require the Wikileaks founder to cooperate.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Which, you know, given his history, doesn't seem super likely.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which, you know, given his history, doesn't seem super likely.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: No, probably not. His legal team must be scrambling right now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, probably not. His legal team must be scrambling right now.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. Extradition hearings could take weeks, and who knows where he ends up.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. Extradition hearings could take weeks, and who knows where he ends up.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Hearings into his possible extradition to America have begun, but will likely take months to conclude.
